info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 2 at 8:16PM CDT until May 2 at 11:15PM CDT by NWS Birmingham AL
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following counties, Greene and Hale.
* WHEN...Until 1115 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 816 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Eutaw, Moundville, Forkland, Akron, Boligee, Walden Quarters, Wedgeworth, Evansville, Allison, Thornhill, Knoxville, Tishabee, Eutaw Municipal Airport, Selden Lock And Dam, I 20 Rest Area Near Eutaw, Five Points Intersection, Moundville Airport, Mound State Park and Elliots Creek.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM CDT THIS EVENING
